message.content: Writing both sides of the equation $\log_x 4=\log_{27} 3$ with a common logarithm base, we obtain $\frac{\log 4}{\log x} = \frac{\log 3}{\log 27} = \frac{1}{\log 3 - \log 9}$. Cross-multiplying gives $$\log x = \frac{\log 4}{\log 3 - \log 9}.$$If we let $r = \log 3$, then, by the properties of logarithms, $\log 9 = \log(3^2) = 2 \log 3 = 2r$, so $\frac{1}{\log 3 - \log 9} = \frac{1}{r - 2r} = -\frac{1}{r}$.  Substituting for $\frac{\log 4}{\log 3 - \log 9}$ in the equation above, we get $$\log x = -\frac{\log 4}{\log 3} = -\log_3 4,$$from which $x = 3^{-\log_3 4} = \boxed{\frac{1}{4}}$.
